VLIB_legendreMoments

Detailed Description


Functions

void VLIB_legendreMoments (const int16_t Im[restrict], int16_t LMoments[restrict], const int16_t LPoly[restrict], const int32_t Order, const int32_t ImH, const int16_t Factor1)

Function Documentation

void VLIB_legendreMoments ( const int16_t  Im[restrict],
int16_t  LMoments[restrict],
const int16_t  LPoly[restrict],
const int32_t  Order,
const int32_t  ImH,
const int16_t  Factor1 
)

Description
The function returns a square matrix M of dimension (Order+1) where Order is the specified maximum order of moments required. Entries M(i,j) such that i+j < Order correspond to the required Legendre moments.
Parameters:
[in] Im[] Input image patch (SQ0.15)
[in,out] LMoments[] Buffer to hold the computed Legendre moments (SQ0.15)
[in] LPoly[] Buffer returned from call to VLIB_legendreMoments_Init (SQ0.15)
[in] Order Required order of moments (SQ31.0)
[in] ImH Image height (SQ31.0)
[in] Factor1 Constant value returned by VLIB_legendreMoments_Init (SQ0.15)
Assumptions
  • The pixel intensities should be normalized to be in [0,1].
  • The image should be square, image height = image width.
  • The ImH parameter should be a multiple of 4.
  • The largest image supported is 256x256.
  • The largest order of moments supported is 40.
  • LMoments should be initialized to 0
  • LPoly is independent of the pixel intensities, and is dependent only on the size of the image (ImH) and the Order of the moment values required
  • LPoly must be of dimension (Order+1)x(ImH)
  • LMoments must be of dimension (Order+1)x(Order+1)
Benchmarks:
See VLIB_Test_Report.html for cycle and memory information.
